description: Single storey rear extension; alterations to enlarge existing basement; rear roof extension (involving conversion of roofspace to habitable use) and installation of two rooflights to side roofslope
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): 01 Rev D1, 001 Rev D1, 002 Rev D1, 003 Rev D1, 004 Rev D1, 005 Rev D1, 006 Rev D1, 007 Rev D1, 008 Rev D1, 009 Rev D1, 010 Rev D1, 101 Rev D1, 102 Rev D1, 103 Rev D1, 104 Rev D1, 106 Rev D1, 107 D1, 108 Rev D2, 109 Rev D1, 111 Rev D1, 111 Rev D2, 105 Rev D2
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the existing building and those as described on the plans.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies LV 7.4 and 7B, policies 1.1(g), 2.1(c) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015).

| A detailed method statement relating to the excavation and construction of the basement extension and lightwell shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced. The statement shall include details of:
-	Phasing and programming, including likely timing to complete the works
-	Removal of earth from the site
-	Construction methods
-	Site management and access
-	Vehicle and machinery specification
-	Number / frequency of vehicles / deliveries
-	Parking of construction vehicles
-	Routeing of vehicles

-	Noise and vibration mitigation measures. Information submitted should directly cross-reference with the BPM & mitigation measures as detailed in the BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.Air Quality (Dust) Risk Assessment produced in accordance with current guidance The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition, SPG, GLA, July 2014. A scheme for air pollution.

-	Air Quality (Dust) Risk Assessment produced in accordance with current guidance The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition, SPG, GLA, July 2014. A scheme for air pollution.
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved method statement or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In the interest of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and Policy 5.18 of the London Plan 2015.

| Prior to the commencement development, a  full tree protection report, survey and drawings must be provided to BS5837 2012 covering all areas of the position and type of fencing to protect the entire root areas/crown spread of the TPO trees located along the shared boundary within/outside the site, access required for demolition works, working areas, removal of debris and any possible site facilities and access to this land including any other equipment required on site, shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval. No site clearance works or development shall be commenced until these drawings have been approved and the fencing has been erected in accordance with the details approved.  . The fencing shall be retained in position until works are completed. The area within the approved protective fencing shall remain undisturbed during the course of the works and in particular:
-There shall be no changes in ground levels;
-No materials or plant shall be stored;
-No buildings or temporary buildings shall be erected or stationed.
-No materials or waste shall be burnt; and.
-No drain runs or other trenches shall be dug or otherwise created.

Reason:  In order to safeguard trees and other vegetation considered to be worthy of retention in the interests of the visual amenity of the area as a whole, in pursuance to the objectives of section 11 and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies7.4, 7.8 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2015,  policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2(f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines' and British Standard 5837:2012 'Trees In Relation To Construction Recommendations'.
